name: Bentley (Bond)
description: James Bond's luxurious Bentley car featured in Ian Fleming's Casino Royale, symbolizing prestige and power.

content.title: Overview
content.body: In Casino Royale, Ian Fleming depicts James Bond as the owner of an elegant Bentley, reflecting the character’s sophistication and status. The Bentley serves not only as Bond’s mode of transportation but also as an extension of his identity—a blend of style, power, and British luxury. The choice of Bentley underlines Bond’s affinity for classic, refined automobiles that command respect.

content.title: Appearance
content.body: The Bentley driven by Bond is described as a sporty, polished vehicle with a sleek exterior, embodying mid-20th-century design aesthetics characterized by smooth curves, a gleaming chrome grille, and a spacious, luxurious interior. Its classic British craftsmanship is evident in every detail, representing speed, comfort, and elegance combined.

content.title: Function
content.body: Beyond transportation, Bond’s Bentley functions as a statement vehicle, used to impress allies and intimidate adversaries. Its powerful performance supports Bond’s capability to escape or pursue in high-stakes scenarios. The car also symbolizes Bond’s worldly sophistication and the lifestyle befitting an elite British secret agent during the Cold War.

content.title: History
content.body: Bentley Motors Limited has been synonymous with British luxury car manufacturing since the early 20th century. Ian Fleming’s inclusion of a Bentley in Casino Royale is consistent with the brand’s association with high society and influence. Bond’s use of the Bentley was part of establishing the character’s persona as a gentleman spy with an eye for fine things, a motif that would persist in later novels and adaptations.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: In Casino Royale, the Bentley represents Bond’s status and confidence as a secret service agent coursing through glamorous settings. The car is an iconic accessory, symbolizing his refined taste and the opulence of his covert world. This vehicle also sets the tone for Bond’s aristocratic and meticulous approach to his dangerous missions.
